alert.note: Alert for Fort Bend; Harris (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 8:32AM CST until January 29 at 8:34AM CST by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... Cypress Creek Near Sharp Road affecting Fort Bend and Harris Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Wharton, Austin, Colorado and Fort Bend Counties. For the Cypress Creek...including Eldridge Parkway, Mathis Road, Sharp Road, Katy-Hockley Road, Hufmeister Road, Grant Road, Kohrville, Stuebner-Airline Road, Westfield, Kuykendahl Road, Cypresswood Drive, Inverness Forest...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cypress Creek Near Sharp Road. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:20 AM CST Friday the stage was 165.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:20 AM CST Friday was 165.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 166.0 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 164.2 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 166.2 feet on 05/29/2014. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1045 PM CST.
